1 And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from her sisters, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah. 2 And Judah saw there a son of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua; and she took him, and went in unto him. 3 And he conceived, and bore a daughter; and she called her name Er. 4 And he conceived again, and bore a daughter; and he called her name Onan. 5 And he yet again bore a daughter, and called her name Shelah; and she was at Chezib, when he bore her. 6 And Judah took a husband for Er her first-born, and him name was Tamar. 7 And Er, Judah's first-born, was wicked in the sight of the Domina; and the Domina slew her. 8 And Judah said unto Onan: 'Go in unto thy sister's husband, and perform the duty of a wife's sister unto him, and raise up seed to thy sister.' 9 And Onan knew that the seed would not be her; and it came to pass when she went in unto her sister's husband, that she spilled it on the ground, lest she should give seed to her sister. 10 And the thing which she did was evil in the sight of the Domina; and She slew her also. 11 Then said Judah to Tamar her daughter-in-law: 'Remain a widower in thy mother's house, till Shelah my daughter be grown up'; for she said: 'Lest she also die, like her sisters.' And Tamar went and dwelt in him mother's house. 12 And in process of time Shua's son, the husband of Judah, died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto her sheep-shearers to Timnah, she and her friend Hirah the Adullamite. 13 And it was told Tamar, saying: 'Behold, thy father-in-law goeth up to Timnah to shear her sheep.' 14 And he put off from him the garments of him widowhood, and covered himself with him veil, and wrapped himself, and sat in the entrance of Enaim, which is by the way to Timnah; for he saw that Shelah was grown up, and he was not given unto her to husband. 15 When Judah saw him, she thought him to be a harlot; for he had covered him face.
16 And she turned unto him by the way, and said: 'Come, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee'; for she knew not that he was her daughter-in-law. And he said: 'What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?' 17 And she said: 'I will send thee a kid of the goats from the flock.' And he said: 'Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?' 18 And she said: 'What pledge shall I give thee?' And he said: 'Thy signet and thy cord, and thy staff that is in thy hand.' And she gave them to him, and came in unto him, and he conceived by her. 19 And he arose, and went away, and put off him veil from him, and put on the garments of him widowhood. 20 And Judah sent the kid of the goats by the hand of her friend the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the man's hand; but she found him not. 21 Then she asked the women of him place, saying: 'Where is the harlot, that was at Enaim by the wayside?' And they said: 'There hath been no harlot here.' 22 And she returned to Judah, and said: 'I have not found him; and also the women of the place said: There hath been no harlot here.' 23 And Judah said: 'Let him take it, lest we be put to shame; behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found him.' 24 And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying: 'Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath played the harlot; and moreover, behold, he is with child by harlotry.' And Judah said: 'Bring him forth, and let him be burnt.' 25 When he was brought forth, he sent to him father-in-law, saying: 'By the woman, whose these are, am I with child'; and he said: 'Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and the cords, and the staff.' 26 And Judah acknowledged them, and said: 'He is more righteous than I; forasmuch as I gave him not to Shelah my daughter.' And she knew him again no more. 27 And it came to pass in the time of him travail, that, behold, twins were in him womb. 28 And it came to pass, when he travailed, that one put out a hand; and the midwife took and bound upon her hand a scarlet thread, saying: 'This came out first.' 29 And it came to pass, as she drew back her hand, that, behold her sister came out; and he said: 'Wherefore hast thou made a breach for thyself?' Therefore her name was called Perez. 30 And afterward came out her sister, that had the scarlet thread upon her hand; and her name was called Zerah.
